item.title: Former Rockstar Co-Founder Says Using AI For Gaming Isn’t “That Useful”
item.content:encoded:
Dan Houser has been on a media cycle to promote his new book. Obviously, gaming questions and quandaries are being thrown his way, and the Rockstar Games co-founder has opened up on AI usage in gaming, how he’s using it for his new game, and how it’s not all that.

AI is everywhere. You can’t get away from it. We’ve gone from harmless ChatGPT prompts to full-blown AI use across all media. AI’s use in gaming is causing a constant stir, and Dan Houser has discussed how his new game with Absurd Ventures is using it, and why it’s not as useful as it seems.

Dan Houser Using AI For New Game At Absurd Ventures

In an interview on the Sunday Brunch talk show, Houser was asked about his new book, called ‘A Better Paradise,’ aptly all about AI and an aspiring developer creating the perfect computer game:

“We are making a game, set in the same world, but not exactly the same story. We’ve begun work on that about 18 months ago, and that’ll be another few years in development.”

The Rockstar co-founder was asked about the use of AI in his upcoming game. He’s very candid about using it, but offers some pushback on the technology:

“We are dabbling in using AI, but the truth is it’s not as useful as some of the companies would have you believe yet. It’s not going to solve all of the problems.”

The progression of AI and whether he thinks it’s moving faster than it ever has before also came up:

“In specific areas, yes, and in other areas when we have a whole field of areas we need technology for, and AI is great at some of the tasks and can’t do the other tasks yet. So people will claim that is [AI] can solve every problem, but it really can’t yet. As far as I understand it, it’s a hold all term for future computing, and it’s not really doing a lot of the stuff yet. But if we all give it all of our money, it might do it in the future.”

The interview with former Rockstar co-founder Dan Houser and the AI exchange can be watched below.

What do you think about the use of AI in gaming? Is it going too far? Or is this merely the beginning of a gradual transition to an era fueled mostly by AI tools and development? The Insider Gaming Discord Server is the perfect place to strike up this controversial topic.

Keep reading more IG news, such as the leaked Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake Gameplay Presentation, and Treyarch Making Big Changes To “Improve” The Black Ops 7 Battle Pass.

item.title: INTERVIEW: Dispatch Developers Talk Game’s Success, Company Leadership, Future Hopes, and More!
item.content:encoded:
Adhoc Studio’s Dispatch is one of the biggest hits of the year. The episodic game launched in October, and recently wrapped its eight-episode season.

Since its release on October 22, the game has received wide praise from players and critics alike. Insider Gaming’s Mike Straw even called it one of the best-looking and most enjoyable games of the year.

Now, in the latest episode of the Insider Gaming Developer Spotlight, Straw sits down with AdHoc Studio’s Dennis Lenart and Charles Marcolim. In this nearly 40-minute interview, Mike, Dennis, and Charles talk about Dispatch’s sales success, the state of the gaming industry, evolution in technology from the time at Telltale to now, future hopes for the franchise, and so much more.

Check out the full interview below, and be sure to go subscribe to Insider Gaming on YouTube. And don’t forget to download the new Insider Gaming App. It’s available for free on Android devices with the iOS release coming soon.

Dispatch Interview Timestamps

Below you can find general timestamps for the conversation. If you want more detailed chapters, open the video directly on YouTube or in the YouTube App.

00:00 – Introduction and guest introductions
02:47 – Industry layoffs and studio survival pressure
08:51 – Episodic release strategy and live adjustments
13:37 – Tech evolution and integrating gameplay with story
23:30 – Tone shifts, episode 4’s opening, and characters
31:01 – Future of Dispatch, attachment to the world, and Beef

For more Insider Gaming, check out the best-selling Xbox 360 games of all-time. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Splitgate 2 To Officially Relaunch In 2025 After Beta Ends
item.content:encoded:
The developers of Splitgate 2 have announced that the beta season will end on December 4, 2025, and the game will relaunch later that month.

For those unaware, the developers of Splitgate 2 revealed earlier this year that they will be “going back to beta” to rebuild significant parts of the game. It seems the developers have now spent enough time retesting the title and are confident enough to bring it back to the market.

Splitgate 2 Beta Ends on December 4

The beta end date for Splitgate 2 was revealed through a new update on their Steam page. The announcement shows that the Beta Season & active Battle Passes will be ending, alongside seasonal “rank” progress on December 4. Moreover, the beta servers will be taken down on the same day to prepare for the relaunch later that month. Details for Splitgate 2’s final beta playlist are live, and it kicked off on November 22.

The final Beta playtest for Splitgate 2 features Karman Station, a new power weapon, and some party modes. Karman Station was the first map ever made at 1047 games and features thoughtful adjustments to fit the modern sandbox. The final beta will also bring back the Rail Gun and will focus on a Party Mix playlist featuring updated versions of Team SWAT, Team Fiesta & Shotty Snipers with more to come.

How Has Going Back to Beta Changed Splitgate 2?

The developers also spoke about how the beta has helped the title, revealing that they have “rebuilt the entire foundation around what makes Splitgate special: portals, movement, and pure gunplay.” Factions have been removed entirely, and abilities have been reimagined as power-ups. Classic roundless modes like King of the Hill, Domination, and Team Deathmatch are back and added Classic Arena.

Moreover, the developers have introduced new maps, new weapons, reworked the menus, and refined systems based on Player feedback. They have also added portal overloading and EMPs, which change how map control works. Equipment has been streamlined for combat clarity, controller feel has been tuned, critical bugs have been fixed, and countless optimizations have been made.

In other news, the Splitgate 2 devs have begged fans for one more chance at their relaunch. Additionally, 1047 Games held another round of layoffs to go back to beta. What are your thoughts on Splitgate 2’s beta ending soon and the relaunch happening in 2025? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Sonic Racing CrossWorlds leak revealing the Pac-Man DLC’s release window. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Leak Reveals Pac-Man DLC Release Window
item.content:encoded:
A new leak for Sonic Racing CrossWorlds reveals that the Pac-Man DLC is expected to arrive in January 2026.

Sonic Racing CrossWorlds has been out for some time now, bringing good competition to the kart racing space. Recently, we also learned that the game will be facing Mario Kart World next month, with the title receiving a Nintendo Switch 2 release date. Now, the next DLC’s release window for the title has been leaked.

Pac-Man DLC for Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Arrives in January 2026

The release window for Sonic Racing CrossWorlds’ Pac-Man DLC was revealed by a user on X (formerly Twitter). Their recent post includes an in-game screenshot with “Crossover Course, Release expected in January” written on it. The course is locked and Pac-Man-themed, with Pac-Man himself driving a kart alongside Sonic. When asked how they came across this find, the user revealed that they updated the game before the Pac-Man festival, and the devs let them in “an hour early”.

Sonic Racing CrossWorlds is really living up to its name, crossing over with as many franchises as possible. The game has already collaborated with the likes of Persona, Like a Dragon, Minecraft, and more. The latest collaboration is with SpongeBob SquarePants, which, along with new racers, machines, courses, and more, also brought the SpongeBob SquarePants festival, which introduced additional rewards players can acquire.

In other news, Sonic Racing CrossWorlds’ producer has stated that Mario Kart World won’t influence it. Additionally, Sonic the Hedgehog might be renamed to ‘Sonic CD’. What are your thoughts on Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Pac-Man DLC’s release window leaking online? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Resident Evil Requiem devs revealing how Grace differs from previous protagonists. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Hypershot Codes (November 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Hypershot codes for November 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Gems, Coins, and much more.

Hypershot is a high-tempo shooting experience where versatile abilities and various weapons play a major role. Your objective is to become an expert marksman and dominate all game modes without breaking a sweat. To achieve this massive feat, you’ll need extra help from the featured active Hypershot codes. Stack up on free Gems and Coins within a few seconds and instantly unlock the finest weapons and abilities without the tiring grind. By redeeming these Roblox promo codes, all the players will get to reach Hypershot’s gameplay zenith and climb the leaderboard swiftly. 

Active Hypershot Codes

  • THANKSGIVING – 3,000 Gems and 30,000 Coins (New)

Inactive Hypershot Codes

There are no expired codes for Hypershot. If any of the active codes go invalid, they will be added in this section. You can expect the existing active codes to turn inactive during big updates and notable milestones. 

How To Redeem Hypershot Codes

Use these instructions to redeem the active codes in Hypershot:

  1. Launch Hypershot and stay on the game’s main menu. 
  2. Press the “Rewards” button located on the top middle part of the screen. 
  3. Scroll down to the last to spot the code box.
  4. Copy and paste the code into the “ENTER CODE HERE” text box.  
  5. Click the “REDEEM” button to activate the code. 

More About Hypershot Codes

The free Gems can be spent on the abilities featured below: 

These Cases can be purchased using the Coins: 

  • Wooden Case – 5000 Coins
  • Bronze Case – 10,000 Coins
  • Silver Case – 20,000 Coins
  • Gold Case – 30,000 Coins
  • Diamond Case – 40,000 Coins

FAQs on Hypershot codes

What are the latest codes in Hypershot?

THANKSGIVING is the only latest code in Hypershot.

What codes can be redeemed for the maximum amount of Coins in Hypershot?

THANKSGIVING can be redeemed for a staggering 30,000 Coins.  

When will the active codes expire in Hypershot?

The active codes are speculated to expire during major in-game updates.

item.title: Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake Gameplay Presentation Leaks Online
item.content:encoded:
A 10-minute video of a Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake gameplay presentation leak has appeared online. It shows live motion capture scenes being played out, discusses the story, and important changes for Farah.

Insider Gaming recently provided a Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake release update. The game is still happening, it’s still in development, and we shouldn’t have to wait too much longer.

In the meantime, a huge leak has emerged—which Ubisoft initially had removed for copyright—showing what appears to be a focus group presentation, and it’s now viewable online.

Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake Focus Group Presentation Leaks Online

The video was first reported on the Reddit GamingLeaksAndRumors page by siliconwolf13. It claimed to be a “Leaked pitch deck for Prince of Persia: Sands of Time remake from Q1 2024.”

Meaning, the presentation is nearly two years old at this point.

The thread was updated to say that the original video was pulled from YouTube, and the reasoning is clear-cut: “This video is no longer available due to a copyright claim by Ubisoft.”

This video is very real, and Ubisoft did not want anyone to see this. The good news is that the video has been reuploaded and mirrored to avoid further copyright claims.

It starts with a brief explanation of the Princess Farah character, running through her profile. It then guides us through the Sands of Time Remake story, before showing off live-action motion capture. The video quality isn’t the best, and the gameplay looks like it’s very much in the alpha stages. But it’s fascinating to see where the game started.

We also learn about how Farah has grown in the remake. She’s no longer an innocent support character, and Farah comes equipped with a bow to protect herself. The presentation also mentions players can “Parkour a world rebuilt from the ground up, expanded with 2 new locations.“

You can see the full Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake leaked gameplay presentation right here.

There’s a lot of information and revelations to take in here. Given that this is from early 2024, players will need to wait and see how much of this content makes it into the final game. Let Insider Gaming know what you think by messaging us (and the community) via the Insider Gaming Official Discord Server.

News comes thick and fast here at IG. Make sure you don’t miss the alleged reason Dan Houser Left Rockstar Games, as well as a Far Cry TV Series Being Announced.
